message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS 

Reasoning: The paper deals with coding theory and information theory, specifically the problem of constructing codes for binary erasure channels. This falls under the sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses non-linear sparse-graph codes and belief propagation, which are topics related to coding theory and graph theory, respectively. Therefore, the paper could also be categorized under Combinatorics and Coding Theory (cs.CC), Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI), Signal Processing (cs.SI), and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS).
